items.title: Ashes 2025: Nathan Lyon's axing leaves Australia struggling on docile Gabba pitch in second Test

items.title: Alleged manslaughter victim told classmate she was 'treated like a slave' at home, court hears

items.summary: A rare set of conjoined twins are being urgently airlifted from Papua New Guinea to Australia, with doctors recommending they be separated as soon as possible.

items.summary: Porongurup businesses are frustrated by what they describe as a lack of communications and urgency surrounding a 6-day mobile outage.

items.title: Arthur Higgins, veteran sports broadcaster who also covered the Moon landing and 9/11, dies aged 85

items.summary: A wedge-tailed eagle's nest was moved in an operation costing about $100,000 involving a 60-tonne crane, a specialist arborist and a carefully engineered basket.

items.title: Police lay additional 775 charges against Melbourne junior doctor accused of hospital toilet recordings
items.summary: A trainee surgeon accused of secretly filming women in hospital toilets and bathroom is facing hundreds of additional charges.

items.title: Data centre spending spree and housing boom drive economic growth
items.summary: Australia's economy grew by 0.4 per cent in the September quarter, driven by data centre spending spree and housing boom

items.title: Humanitarian migrants in US fear being deported into danger following shooting
items.summary: The Trump administration's escalating restrictions on humanitarian migration are leaving some of the United States's most vulnerable diaspora communities terrified for their futures.

items.title: Report shows violent attacks and street abuse 'the norm' for Australian Jews, peak body says
items.summary: Executive Council of Australian Jewry Alex Ryvchin said the data showed antisemitism remained at "deeply troubling levels".

items.title: Football presenter Laura Woods collapses during scary on-air moment
items.summary: Laura Woods says she is doing 'OK' after collapsing on-air during an England match.

items.title: Sabrina Carpenter slams White House for using her music in ICE video
items.summary: Two-time Grammy winner Sabrina Carpenter slams the White House for using her song in a social media post about ICE raids, telling the Trump administration to never involve her in its "inhumane agenda".

items.title: Court dismisses Bruce Lehrmann's appeal against rape defamation finding
items.summary: Bruce Lehrmann has lost his appeal against a Federal Court ruling that found on the balance of probabilities he had raped his then-colleague Brittany Higgins at Parliament House in 2019.

items.title: Trains remain suspended after car falls from bridge, lands on tracks in the Blue Mountains
items.summary: Sydney Trains crews are continuing complex repairs on the Blue Mountains line after a car crashed off a bridge onto train tracks yesterday morning.

items.title: Sam Kerr praised in Matildas return as Australia beats New Zealand 2-0
items.summary: Sam Kerr makes her long-awaited return to the Matildas on home soil as Australia downs New Zealand 2-0.

items.title: WA Police Arson Squad pinpoint ignition point of Geraldton bushfire that destroyed home
items.summary: Police offer up a $25,000 reward as they try to determine the cause of a blaze that tore through 160 hectares of land, left two homes uninhabitable and completely destroyed another in Geraldton.

items.title: Hobart's Macquarie Point stadium project set to pass Tasmanian parliament
items.summary: A stadium on Hobart's waterfront has gained enough support to pass parliament, after key independents declared they would support the contentious project — as it happened.

items.title: Federal politics: YouTube 'outright weird' for saying platform isn't safe, Anika Wells says — as it happened
items.summary: YouTube agrees to comply with Australia's under 16s social media ban but repeats its criticism of the law and says it "won't keep teens safer online".

items.title: Gold Coast council's Springbrook cableway edges forward but with slashed funding
items.summary: The Gold Coast's long-running cableway proposal has inched forward after councillors redirected funds from First Nations consultation to environmental studies.

items.title: Three in four autistic children want to play more sport but avoidable barriers stand in their way
items.summary: Hayley masks their struggles so well in dance class that teachers can't tell. But when they get home, they collapse — sometimes missing days of school.

items.title: England cricketing great Robin Smith dies in Perth aged 62
items.summary: The cricket world mourns after the death of English batting great Robin Smith in his Perth home.

items.title: Three Paralympians talk about how disability altered their lives in documentary Changing Track
items.summary: Filmmaking siblings Tristan and Timothy Kenyon's documentary Changing Track explores how competing in the Paralympics changes lives.

items.title: Indonesian diaspora divided over new Global Citizenship visa scheme as new details emerge
items.summary: Indonesia's new visa scheme is being touted as a solution to dual citizenship. But some in the Indonesian community say the visa has "no real benefit" and amounts to a government revenue grab.

items.title: South-East Asian floods leave more than 1 million people homeless across Indonesia and Sri Lanka
items.summary: More than 1,300 people are dead and 1.2 million displaced following devastating flooding and landslides in South-East Asia.

items.title: Backpackers and PALM scheme workers scrambling for jobs after Dicky Bill shutdown
items.summary: Backpackers and PALM workers in Victoria and Queensland are looking for new jobs following the shock shutdown of Dicky Bill Australia.

items.title: Man charged in National Guard shooting pleads not guilty from hospital bed
items.summary: Rahmanullah Lakanwal, 29, has pleaded not guilty to first-degree murder and assault charges.

items.title: Australia's longest-running radio show celebrates 80 years of rural storytelling
items.summary: Australia's longest-running radio show is celebrating 80 years on air, and while so much has changed in farming and broadcasting, the core of The Country Hour remains the same.

items.title: Proton therapy cancer unit debacle leads to $US32 million lawsuit
items.summary: Seven years ago, cancer patients forced to travel overseas for proton therapy were promised an Australian-based service — but the project collapsed last year and is now at the centre of a multi-million-dollar lawsuit.

items.title: Foo Fighters announce Launceston concert for January
items.summary: Foo Fighters, one of the biggest bands in the world, will play just one small Australian city when they travel out here in January.

items.title: Environment Protection Authority to monitor Ballarat Gold Mine amid air pollution concerns
items.summary: Ballarat Gold Mine has exceeded national standards for potentially dangerous air pollutants.

items.title: Australia's day-night Ashes Test against England comes months after a demolition of West Indies
items.summary: The last time Australia played a Test with the pink ball, the brilliance of Mitchell Starc and Scott Boland turned the game into a farce.

items.title: Small businesses losing thousands to fraudulent online chargeback claims
items.summary: Frustrated retailers grappling with online shoplifters are calling for better protections from banks, payment providers and regulators.

items.title: The secret sauce powering the schools punching above their weight in NAPLAN
items.summary: Parents can check the latest NAPLAN scores for 10,000 schools across the country on the MySchool website.

items.title: Distance quiz: How well do you know your Australian islands?
items.summary: Do you know how far away Heard Island is? What about Christmas Island? Try your hand at today's quiz.

items.title: Today in history, December 3: Bhopal gas leak kills thousands in world's worst industrial accident
items.summary: It started with a cloud of gas in the dead of night, silently submerging the city in a toxic soup. By morning on December 3, 1984, an Indian city awoke to a nightmare.

items.title: Court lifts suppression order on Greg Lynn's past interactions with police, death of first wife
items.summary: Victoria's Supreme Court lifts a suppression order that prohibited reporting on convicted murderer Greg Lynn's past interactions with police and the death of his first wife.

items.title: Lemon8 and Yope put on notice as social media age ban targets
items.summary: Social media platforms Lemon8 and Yope are put on notice about age limit laws as both apps surge in popularity ahead of a ban for under 16s.

items.title: WA Electoral Commissioner Robert Kennedy resigns months after problem-plagued state election
items.summary: Robert Kennedy tends his resignation as WA electoral commissioner, nine months after a state election that was plagued by issues including long wait-times to vote, and polling booths running out of ballot papers.

items.title: Bruce Lehrmann to learn fate of his Federal Court appeal of failed defamation case
items.summary: A decision in Bruce Lehrmann's Federal Court appeal to the findings in his failed defamation case against Network Ten will be handed down tomorrow — and whatever the outcome, there will be consequences for all.

items.title: Government reveals national AI plan to 'serve' Australians
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Tasmanian politicians feel the pressure ahead of Macquarie Point Stadium vote
items.summary: State politicians face a looming debate in parliament's upper house, which will finally decide whether a stadium is built at Hobart's Macquarie Point and whether Tasmania gets an AFL side.

items.title: ACT legislates commitment for public servants to uphold 'Closing the Gap principle' in Australian first
items.summary: Senior ACT public servants will soon be required to demonstrate their work towards ending the inequality experienced by First Nations people.

items.title: Six prisoners remain in NT watch houses after report exposes 'inhumane' conditions
items.summary: Days after acting Northern Territory Ombudsman Bronwyn Haack raised the alarm about "inhumane" conditions in overcrowded police cells, the government says just six inmates remain.

items.title: Singapore-based firm scraps Darwin hotel project after sacred site fight
items.summary: A $100 million luxury hotel planned for the Darwin Waterfront has fallen through, after concerns were raised by Larrakia traditional owners over its interference with a sacred site.

items.title: Three deaths related to asbestos exposure at former ABC site
items.summary: Staff at the former ABC studios in Elsternwick were exposed to asbestos over an extended period.

items.title: Usman Khawaja ruled out of Brisbane Test following back injury, Travis Head set to open
items.summary: Australia will be without veteran opener Usman Khawaja for the second Ashes Test after the 38-year old was ruled out due to an ongoing back problem.

items.title: England trio Ben Stokes, Mark Wood and Jamie Smith spotted riding e-scooters without helmets in Brisbane
items.summary: England captain Ben Stokes and several teammates have been spotted in Brisbane riding e-scooters without helmets ahead of the second Ashes Test.

items.title: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne breached parliamentarians' code of conduct with anonymous text criticising Elizabeth Lee
items.summary: ACT Attorney-General Tara Cheyne is found to have breached the code of conduct for a parliamentarian over an anonymous text message she sent criticising former Canberra Liberals leader Elizabeth Lee.

items.title: Parkway Drive's Park Waves festival cancelled ahead of 2026 Australian debut
items.summary: Park Waves festival, set for February 2026, has been cancelled amid economic challenges, joining a growing list of scrapped Australian music events.

items.title: Optus reveals nearly half a million phones may be unable to dial Triple Zero
items.summary: The figure has been provided to a Senate estimates hearing, where the media regulator appeared on Tuesday.

items.title: Rise in threats by sovereign citizens sparks call for Victorian judges to receive security allowance
items.summary: A report tabled in state parliament has recommended judicial officers be paid an allowance to increase their personal security.

items.title: New images show Chinese flotilla with formidable firepower in Philippine Sea
items.summary: Private firm Starboard Maritime Intelligence says it has used satellite technology to track down the People's Liberation Army Navy task group.

items.title: Echuca man Jake Cartledge jailed over 'horrific' crash that killed girlfriend and younger brother
items.summary: A young driver who attempted a "power skid" before slamming into a tree has been sentenced over the deaths of his girlfriend and younger brother.

items.title: Canberra man jailed over violent road rage incidents, fined for performing Nazi salute outside synagogue
items.summary: A Canberra man has been jailed over a string of road rage attacks committed "for trivial reasons", and fined $10,000 for performing a Nazi salute outside a Queensland synagogue.

items.title: Neighbour called abuse line to report mother accused of daughter's neglect, court hears
items.summary: A former neighbour of a mother standing trial accused of criminally neglecting her daughter tried to report concerns to an abuse line, but her call went unanswered, a court has heard.

items.title: Concerns still remain as Northern Water names site for $5bn desal plant
items.summary: The long-awaited decision for a Northern Water project has arrived — but it has come with environmental contention.

items.title: Pilliga murder trial hinges on mental state of man who killed his father
items.summary: The mental state of a man who has admitted to killing his father at Pilliga in north-west New South Wales will be key to the outcome of his murder trial.

items.title: Australian National University abandons plan to axe the School of Music after public pressure
items.summary: The Australian National University has abandoned a controversial plan to absorb its School of Music into a single course after extraordinary public pressure.

items.title: My daughter has two mums. I'm her other mother
items.summary: Even though I am Evie's favourite — I am, after all, the fun mum — I can't shake the feeling that when it comes to serious mothering, I'm the spare. Her back-up mum.

items.title: Tank Cave diver Gary Gibson remembered as internal investigation begins into SA death
items.summary: The 65-year-old Victorian man who died while cave diving in South Australia's south-east has been described as "fastidious" and as having a dark sense of humour, as an internal investigation is launched into what led to his death.

items.title: Beekeepers warn of food price increases amid varroa mite battle in South Australia
items.summary: Beekeepers say the escalating cost of pollinating crops will be passed onto consumers as the industry battles a devastating bee killer.

items.title: Spear fisher accused of killing protected blue groper on NSW Central Coast
items.summary: Investigations are underway into the death of the near-threatened species on the NSW Central Coast, prompting calls for better awareness about local marine life.

items.title: Man pleads guilty over culpable driving hit and run that killed motorcyclist at Yarck
items.summary: David Graham Berry was set to face trial over a hit and run in northern Victoria, but has instead pleaded guilty at a hearing in Shepparton.

items.title: New details of ADF sexual violence probe revealed
items.summary: Minister Matt Keogh is addressing the National Press Club a year after the government responded to the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide.

items.title: Victoria's first summer Japanese encephalitis virus detection at Horsham in state's west
items.summary: The first detection of Japanese encephalitis virus for the summer has been made in a rural Victorian city.

items.title: Papua New Guinea calls for 'buffer zone' with Indonesia amid concerns over West Papua conflict
items.summary: Australia, Papua New Guinea and Indonesia have started holding annual defence ministers meetings to build trust and boost military cooperation, while PNG proposes building a 10km-wide demilitarised "buffer zone" along its border with Indonesia.

items.title: E-bike rider killed in collision with garbage truck in Sydney CBD as NSW premier announces new legislation
items.summary: The rider, a man aged in his 30s, was treated by paramedics but could not be saved.

items.title: Perth Bears sign halfback Toby Sexton and England international Harry Newman for 2027 NRL season
items.summary: The NRL's Perth expansion team secures the signature of former Bulldogs halfback Toby Sexton and England international Harry Newman for their inaugural season in 2027.

items.title: Experts unsure why sea snake deaths are increasing at Shark Bay World Heritage site
items.summary: Locals and marine life experts raise concern over an increased amount of reptiles washing up on WA's north-west shores, with reports of stranded sea snakes and turtles being spotted on beaches.

items.title: Right to repair reforms to be expanded to farm machinery
items.summary: After years of depending on dealership networks for essential repairs, farmers will have the right to fix their own equipment.

items.title: Farmer killed fighting West River bushfire near Ravensthorpe on WA's south coast
items.summary: A man is killed while trying to establish a firebreak to help tackle a blaze near Ravensthorpe along WA's south coast, with the premier describing his death as "devastating".

items.title: South Coast fishermen charged over alleged deliberate scuttling of trawler
items.summary: Two Ulladulla fishermen have been charged under federal sea-dumping laws over the alleged deliberate sinking of an unseaworthy trawler.
